title: Sallier de la Tour 2015 La Monaca Syrah (Monreale)
description: Made entirely with Syrah, this opens with earthy aromas of black-skinned berry, tilled soil and leather. The forward palate delivers black plum, black currant and a hint of white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: San Biagio 2015 Montersino  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of eucalyptus, underbrush and dark berry emerge from the glass. The solid palate evokes dark cherry, licorice and a hint of white pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2021.

title: Schlumberger Wein- und Sektkellerei 2015 Rosé Klassik Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Toasty notes accompany the lemon and red apple freshness on the nose and promise generosity. The palate, with its very lively froth, obliges and gives rounded, creamy notes of apple and yeast. There is a lovely backdrop of yeasty autolysis, rounded out with generous dosage. The finish is dry and fresh.

title: Torres 2015 Celeste Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Cool, murky berry aromas are gamy. A blast of fruitiness propels a big palate loaded with spicy chocolaty oak. Bold berry flavors are short-lasting on a tight, intense finish. Crianzas are made to drink young, but this will benefit from more aging; drink through 2028.

title: Trisaetum 2016 Wichmann Dundee Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Among an excellent lineup of 2016 Pinots, the Wichmann seems to be the least ripe. Its flavors are tart berry, with lemony acidity and hints of wet leaves. Drink 2021–2025.

title: V. Testulat NV Brut Nature Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: Tight and nervy, this mineral-textured wine keeps the fruit in the background. It is very dry, with the acidity showing strongly. Another few months or a year will do this steely wine the world of good.

title: Viña Mayor 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jammy berry aromas are forward but inexact. A tight powerful palate is narrow in scope, with peppery red-berry flavors propelled by lively acidity. Finishing notes of oak spice and cocoa are notable through a choppy but bold ending.

title: Viñadecanes 2014 Tres Racimos Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Grapy berry aromas are oaky and a touch harsh. A fleshy pulpy palate is sturdy and tannic, while this tastes of airy dark fruits that are more fluffy than tough. Toast and blackberry flavors make for a no-nonsense finish.

title: Vokel 2016 Eastside Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A tiny production from a small producer, this wine has a hearty entry and is hugely oaky and bursting in tannin. Its flavor profile is leathery, savory and smoky.

title: Abacela 2015 Garnacha (Umpqua Valley)
description: The winery has dropped “Barrel Select” from the label, but this remains a barrel selection. In 2015 the finished wine pushes hard against 15% alcohol, and it's fully ripened and then some, with deep plum and black cherry fruits at the core. The tannins bring black tea, smoke and tobacco notes, with a strongly astringent aftertaste.

title: Ada Nada 2013 Chicin Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Subtle, earthy aromas evoking underbrush, baking spice and dark berry set the tone. The linear palate shows dried black cherry, clove and ground pepper alongside firm, rather evolved tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Alexana 2016 East Blocks-Volcanic Soils Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The winery does an East and West block selection, this being the more open and broadly fruity of the pair. Rather soft, rounded fruit flavors of raspberries with a backing of citrus oil keep the flavors fresh and lively. Drink now and over the next half decade.

title: Alvides 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Dark oaky aromas of minty black fruits are gritty and concentrated. Following that nose, this is grinding on the palate. Acid-pushed dark-fruit flavors come with an offset of oaky vanilla, while this is clipped and gappy in feel on the finish.

title: Ancien 2015 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: The latest release of Oregon Pinot from this Napa Valley producer is done in a lush and creamy style, with flavors of raspberries, cherries and vanilla in abundance. It's forward and tasty, though rather lightly ripened throughout, and best consumed 2021–2025.

title: Billecart-Salmon NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Crisp, dry and full of red-currant fruits and tight acidity, this is a delicious, young Champagne. It is textured and zesty, with layer of acidity vying with the perfumed fruit. This bottling really should age, so drink it from 2019.

title: Bodega Rolland 2014 Mariflor Pinot Noir (Mendoza)
description: Cocoa, cinnamon and oak aromas are more prominent than fruit on this ripe, full-bodied Pinot Noir. A hard-driving palate is not about elegance, acidity and restraint. Flavors of black cherry, mocha and chocolate are tasty but atypical of most Pinot Noirs. A peppery finish with heavy oak spice seals the deal on this uniquely Rolland-style wine.

title: Bruno Paillard NV Dosage Zéro  (Champagne)
description: While this producer's style is for dry Champagnes, this one is perhaps excessive. Even the ripe fruit can't quite take away the shocking acidity and intensity, making it best for those who like their Champagne to be seriously dry and tight. A few months more might help reduce the shock.

title: Château Tanunda 2014 The Château 100 Year Old Vines Shiraz (Barossa)
description: As the name suggests, this wine is from some seriously old, low-yielding vines. The liberal use of American and French oak, however, does mask the character of those old vines somewhat. It's dense and chocolatey, with plum, black pepper, vanilla and a dusting polish note throughout. The palate is plushly textured and warming, with soft, dusty tannins and a lingering peppery spice.

title: Cochon 2016 Les Sirenes Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Delicately layered and earthy, this wine takes on power as it opens in the glass, ending up in a full-bodied style of robust forest, cardamom and pomegranate. The structure is moderate in acidity.

title: Coelho 2016 Delfina Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: The best of the winery's 2016 vineyard selects, this well-defined wine has flavors of mulberry, sour plum and a touch of lemon. Aging in one-quarter new oak adds some pretty spices, and the overall concentration is enough to carry it for another half decade or so.
